articles.title: Jan. 6 rioter Joshua Black first to be cleared of obstruction charge despite reaching Senate floor
articles.description: The judge said prosecutors failed to prove Joshua Black’s intent was to disrupt Congress – or even whether he was familiar with the proceedings occurring that day to certify Joe Biden’s victory over Donald Trump.
articles.content:
The Justice Department saw the first acquittal of a Jan. 6 rioter on the felony obstruction charge.
Joshua Black, of Alabama, was shot in the face by a police projectile while breaching the US Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. Court documents show him with bl... [2515 chars]

articles.title: Schiff says it’s possible national security was jeopardized with Biden documents
articles.description: Rep. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.) said Congress could not “exclude the possibility” that national security was jeopardized by the handling of President Biden’s classified documents, which are now at the center of a Department of Justice probe. “I don’t think we can exclude the possibility without knowing more of the facts,” Schiff said on ABC’s “This…
articles.content:

articles.title: Trump’s toilet had more papers than Biden’s garage
articles.description: Let’s not sugarcoat it. This classified documents thing looks bad, whether you’re a Biden-loving Democrat or a fire-breathing Republican member of Congress who hates everyone including your own speaker.
articles.content:
If you’re into James Bond movies or Jason Bourne novels, or anything else with intrigue and car chases, you have to kind of love it that classified government secrets were stashed in a garage next to a classic Chevy Corvette.
Okay, stashed is kind of... [3842 chars]

articles.title: Airlines push for FAA system upgrade after major outage
articles.description: Airlines are calling on Congress and the Biden administration to give the FAA more staff and more money to upgrade its systems.
articles.content:
Airlines have been pushing the FAA to modernize the air-traffic control system for years. After this week's outage, they're pushing harder.
Example video title will go here for this video

articles.title: Biden Administration Faces Resistance to Plan to Sell F-16s to Turkey
articles.description: The State Department has contacted Congress about major arms deals for Turkey and Greece, but a prominent senator is strongly opposed to the Ankara sale.
articles.content: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration has informed Congress that it wants to discuss proposed major arms sales for Turkey and Greece, according to two U.S. officials, but it already faces resistance on Capitol Hill to Ankara’s request for new and upg... [1032 chars]

articles.title: Top U.S. lawmaker objects to potential F-16 sale to Turkey
articles.description: The Biden administration has told Congress it is preparing the potential $20 billion sale of F-16 fighter jets to Turkey, sources familiar with the matter said on Friday, sparking an immediate objection from a senior U.S. lawmaker who has long opposed the deal.
articles.content: WASHINGTON, Jan 13 (Reuters) - The Biden administration has told Congress it is preparing the potential $20 billion sale of F-16 fighter jets to Turkey, sources familiar with the matter said on Friday, sparking an immediate objection from a senior U.... [3782 chars]

articles.title: Biden’s Potemkin Village and Our Do-Nothing Congress
articles.description: Amid a border crisis, arrangements were made to clean up El Paso, Texas, for the press.
articles.content: In “Joe Biden, the El Paso Kid” (Main Street, Jan. 10), Bill McGurn gives me so much I want to say—or scream. The Biden-Harris policy on immigration is worthless to nonexistent, so condemning the president and vice president is easy and fun. But the ... [527 chars]

articles.title: Biden admin preparing to ask Congress to approve sale of F-16 jets to Turkey
articles.description: The Biden administration is preparing to ask Congress to approve the sale of 40 F-16 fighter jets to Turkey, after weighing a Turkish request for the planes for more than a year, congressional sources familiar with the deliberations told CNN.
articles.content:
Washington CNN —

articles.content:
WASHINGTON – President Biden will give his second State of the Union address next month in what is expected to be the first such speech delivered before a full-capacity chamber since the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in early 2020.

articles.title: Biden to deliver his State of the Union address on Feb. 7
articles.description: President Joe Biden will deliver his second State of the Union address before Congress on Feb. 7.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON — President Joe Biden will deliver his second State of the Union address before Congress on Feb. 7.
Speaker Kevin McCarthy, R-Calif., invited Biden to deliver the address on that date in a letter Friday.
